extendedIngredients.name: Spice Rub

extendedIngredients.name: baby bok choy
extendedIngredients.original: 12 to 18 yu choy, baby choy sum, or baby bok choy
extendedIngredients.originalName: yu choy, baby choy sum, or baby bok choy

extendedIngredients.name: black bean sauce
extendedIngredients.original: 1 tablespoon Chinese brown bean sauce (not ground)**

extendedIngredients.name: oxtail
extendedIngredients.original: 12 (2- to 2 1/2-inch-thick) oxtail pieces (about 4 1/2 pounds), fat trimmed

title: Braised Oxtails with Star Anise and Chinese Greens
summary: Braised Oxtails with Star Anise and Chinese Greens is a gluten free and dairy free main course. For $6.8 per serving, this recipe covers 22% of your daily requirements of vitamins and minerals. One portion of this dish contains approximately 112g of protein, 46g of fat, and a total of 942 calories. This recipe serves 6. A mixture of available at asian markets, onion, rounds ginger, and a handful of other ingredients are all it takes to make this recipe so delicious. To use up the spice mix you could follow this main course with the Pumpkin Pie Spice Cream Scones as a dessert. Not a lot of people really liked this Chinese dish. 1 person has made this recipe and would make it again. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes about 45 minutes. With a spoonacular score of 49%, this dish is good. Try Braised Oxtails With Chinese Greens, [Gluten Free ] Chinese Chicken, Vegetables & Rice Bowl with Soy & Star Anise Braised Chicken, and Chinese Star Anise-Orange Brine for similar recipes.
instructions: Preparation                                        Arrange oxtails in single layer in heavy large pot. Add next 8 ingredients, then enough water to cover oxtails by 1/2 inch; bring to boil. Reduce heat to low, partially cover, and simmer until very tender, adding more water by 1/2 cupfuls as needed to keep oxtails covered, about 3 hours. Cool slightly. Chill uncovered until cold, then cover and keep chilled at least 1 day and up to 3 days.                                                                            Spoon off and discard fat from sauce. Rewarm oxtails over low heat. Transfer oxtails to large plate. Boil sauce just until reduced enough to coat spoon thinly (do not reduce too much or sauce may become salty). Discard ginger slices and star anise.                                                                            Meanwhile, cook yu choy in large pot of boiling salted water until just tender, about 4 minutes. Drain well.                                                                            Divide yu choy among shallow bowls. Top with oxtails and sauce and sprinkle with green onions.

steps.step: Arrange oxtails in single layer in heavy large pot.

Add next 8 ingredients, then enough water to cover oxtails by 1/2 inch; bring to boil. Reduce heat to low, partially cover, and simmer until very tender, adding more water by 1/2 cupfuls as needed to keep oxtails covered, about 3 hours. Cool slightly. Chill uncovered until cold, then cover and keep chilled at least 1 day and up to 3 days.
Spoon off and discard fat from sauce. Rewarm oxtails over low heat.
Transfer oxtails to large plate. Boil sauce just until reduced enough to coat spoon thinly (do not reduce too much or sauce may become salty). Discard ginger slices and star anise.
Meanwhile, cook yu choy in large pot of boiling salted water until just tender, about 4 minutes.
Divide yu choy among shallow bowls. Top with oxtails and sauce and sprinkle with green onions.
